Securities & Exchange Board of India ( SEBI ) has seized Rs 53.67 crore from Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd along with five other entities. Some of the popular courses offered by the self-proclaimed "options queen" and "She Wolf of Stock Market" are "Let's Make India Trade" (LMIT), "Master's in Price Action Trading" (MPAT), and "Options Multiplier" (OM) .Jayesh Thakkar, a SEBI Registered Research Analyst shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) stating ‚ÄúSEBI has seized Rs 53.67 crore that Asmita Patel and five other related entities made illegally. The entities have also been barred from accessing the securities market.The order also uncovered that fees collected from participants were routed through entities such as King Traders (proprietor: Sagar Dhanjibhai), Gemini Enterprise (proprietor: Suresh Parmashivam), and United Enterprises (proprietor: Jigar Rameshbhai Dawada). Recommendations of buy/sell of specific securities were provided and uploaded on telegram channels owned by the Noticee no.1. The acts of the Noticee no.1 makes it evident that it was providing investment advice/ research analyst services to students/investors/participants for a consideration in the pretext of imparting education.‚Äù

Wilkinson posted on Twitter.Vembu, who positions his company's Zoho Sign as a competitor to DocuSign, didn't hold back in his criticism of the digital signature giant. Article Title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella on the 'one lesson he learned' from Google
Article Text:
‚ÄòI‚Äôve been a part of four big transformations‚Äô: Nadella

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has recently talked about a significant oversight: failing to anticipate the dominance of search as the web's most successful business model, which Google capitalised on, and has said that it is ‚Äúone lesson learned‚Äù for him.‚ÄúWe missed what turned out to be the biggest business model on the web, because we all assumed the web is all about being distributed,‚Äù he said during a recent podcast with Indian YouTuber Dwarkesh Patel.‚ÄúWho would have thought that search would be the biggest winner in organising the web? And so that's where we obviously didn't see it, and Google saw it and executed super well,‚Äù he added.This miscalculation, they admitted, led them to miss out on a massive opportunity, one that Google capitalised on with remarkable success.‚ÄúSo that's one lesson learned for me: you have to not only get the tech trend right, you also have to get where the value is going to be created with that trend. These business model shifts are probably tougher than even the tech trend changes,‚Äù Nadella noted, underscoring the difficulty of predicting how emerging technologies will translate into sustainable and profitable ventures.Nadella explained that he has been a part of four major technological transformations. The first was the shift from mainframes to personal computers and then to client-server architecture.‚ÄúIt was very clear to me. I remember going to what is PDC in '91, in fact I was at Sun at that time. In '91, I went to Moscone. That's when Microsoft first described the Win32 interface and it was pretty clear to me what was going to happen, where the server was also going to be an x86 thing,‚Äù he added.The next major transformation was the emergence of the web, during which the Mosaic browser was released shortly after Nadella joined Microsoft, followed by the Netscape browser .‚ÄúWe had the browser moment, and so we had to adjust. And we did a pretty good job of adjusting to it because the browser was a new app model,‚Äù he added.
Article Summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has talked about a significant oversight: failing to anticipate the dominance of search as the web's most successful business model. ‚ÄòWe missed what turned out to be the biggest business model on the web, because we all assumed the web is all about being distributed,‚Äô he said.

Article Text: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has pushed back against investor concerns that triggered a $600 billion market value drop, asserting that the market misinterpreted the significance of DeepSeek's new AI model."I think the market responded to R1 as an 'Oh my gosh, AI is finished,'" Huang said in a pretaped interview for Nvidia partner DDN. The selloff was sparked by the Chinese AI startup DeepSeek's release of its R1 reasoning model , which reportedly used lower-capability chips for development.The market reaction wiped nearly 20% from Huang's personal net worth, though the company's stock has since recovered most of its losses. "From an investor perspective, there was a mental model that the world was pretraining and then inference," he said. "Obviously, that paradigm is wrong."The CEO stressed that teaching AI models to reason better remains computationally intensive and represents "the next scaling frontier" for the tech sector. This aligns with Nvidia's January statement to Fortune, which highlighted that "inference requires significant numbers of Nvidia GPUs and high-performance networking."The company maintains that three scaling laws govern AI development: "pretraining and post-training, which continue, and new test-time scaling." This suggests that despite advances in model efficiency, the demand for high-performance computing in AI development and deployment remains strong.
Article Summary: N Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says the market misinterpreted the significance of DeepSeek's new AI model. The market reaction wiped nearly 20% from Huang's personal net worth. Investors had worried that major tech companies might reduce their demand for Nvidia's more advanced chips.

Why was TikTok removed from Apple App Store and Google Play Store

TikTok's reinstatement in US app stores following a temporary ban has negatively impacted Chinese competitors that had gained traction during the platform's absence, according to a recent report. These competitors saw a surge in popularity after TikTok was removed from Apple and Google app stores, but have experienced a decline since TikTok's return.Citing Sensor Tower data, Bloomberg reported that downloads of apps like Xiaohongshu plummeted 91% since TikTok‚Äôs reinstatement five days ago.The Chinese social media app Xiaohongshu, which translates to "little red book," saw a surge in popularity in the US, becoming the most downloaded free app in the Apple App Store on January 15th. This surge occurred despite the platform's predominantly Chinese user base of over 300 million.American users are increasingly turning to Xiaohongshu, with some expressing their disagreement with the US government's concerns about the Chinese ownership of TikTok.TikTok, owned by ByteDance, was temporarily removed from app stores on January 18 due to government pressure to divest the app over national security concerns. This led to a surge in popularity for Chinese rival Xiaohongshu (Red), which gained nearly 500,000 US users.Other platforms like YouTube, Snap, Facebook, and Instagram also saw increased usage during TikTok's absence. However, with TikTok's return to the Apple App Store and Google Play on February 14, the app has reportedly seen more than double its usual download rate, the report said.The app‚Äôs reinstatement followed intervention by President Donald Trump , who provided assurances to TikTok and its partners that they would not face penalties for continued operation. While TikTok's app and website remained accessible during the ban, they were unavailable for download until recently.Prior to the reinstatement, Trump had publicly suggested the possibility of the US government taking a significant stake in TikTok, potentially including a role in content moderation. Numerous parties have expressed interest in acquiring the platform, but no sale has been finalised.
